resources.string: Copyright 2008-%s The XryptoMail. Portions Copyright 2006-%s the Android Open Source Project.
Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0.

XryptoMail is an email client for Android with encryption capability.

Its enhance features include:

  • Encrypt/Decrypt Email
  • Push mail using IMAP IDLE
  • Message refiling
  • Email signatures
  • Bcc-to-self
  • Folder subscriptions
  • All folder synchronization
  • Return-address configuration
  • Keyboard shortcuts
  • Better IMAP support
  • Saving attachments to SD
  • Empty Trash
  • Message sorting
  • …and more

Please note that XryptoMail does not support most free Hotmail accounts and, like many mail clients, has some quirks when talking to Microsoft Exchange.

The server presented an invalid SSL certificate. Sometimes, this is because of a server misconfiguration. Sometimes it is because someone is trying to attack you or your mail server. If you\'re not sure what\'s up, click Reject and contact the folks who manage your mail server.\n\n(%s)

Del (or D) - Delete
R - Reply
 A - Reply All
C - Compose
 F - Forward
 M - Move
 V - Archive
 Y - Copy
 Z - Mark (Un)read
 G - Star
 O - Sort type
 I - Sort order
 Q - Return to Folders
 S - Select/deselect
 J or P - Previous Message
 K or N - Next Message

Del (or D) - Delete
 R - Reply
 A - Reply All
 C - Compose
 F - Forward
 M - Move
 Y - Copy
 G - Star
 O - Sort type
 I - Sort order
 Q - Return to Folders
 S - Select/deselect

1 - Display only 1st Class folders
 2 - Display 1st and 2nd Class folders
 3 - Display all except 2nd Class folders
 4 - Display all folders
 Q - Return to Accounts
 S - Edit Account Settings

Unable to authenticate. The server does not advertise the SASL EXTERNAL capability. This could be due to a problem with the client certificate (expired, unknown certificate authority) or some other configuration problem.
"Failed to retrieve client certificate for alias \"%s\""
"Client certificate \"%1$s\" has expired or is not yet valid (%2$s)"
No Drafts folder configured for this account!
No key configured for this account! Check your settings.
Crypto provider uses incompatible version. Please check your settings!
Cannot connect to crypto provider, check your settings or click crypto icon to retry!
Crypto provider access denied, click crypto icon to retry!
PGP/INLINE mode does not support attachments!
The email is sent in PGP/INLINE format.\nThis should only be used for compatibility:
Some clients only support this format
In this mode, your PGP key will be used to create a cryptographic signature of an unencrypted email.
This does not encrypt the email, but verifies that it was sent from your key.
Signatures may break when sent to mailing lists.
Signatures may be displayed as \'signature.asc\' attachments in some clients.
Encrypted messages always include a signature.
must fully download message to process signature
Message is encrypted, but in an unsupported format.
Message is encrypted, but decryption was cancelled.
but end-to-end key didn\'t match sender
but end-to-end key is not considered secure
but there was a decryption error
must fully download message for decryption
but no crypto app is configured
but end-to-end key didn\'t match sender
but end-to-end key is not considered secure
This part was not encrypted, and may be insecure.
Encrypted message must be downloaded for decryption.
Special characters are currently not supported!
Because of this, support for APG has been removed from XryptoMail.
You can click here to learn more.
No OpenPGP app configured, see global settings!
This email has been encrypted with OpenPGP.\nTo read it, you need to install and configure a compatible OpenPGP App.
Error retrieving recipient status from OpenPGP provider!
Some of the selected recipients don\'t support this feature!
Encrypting messages ensures they can be read by the recipient, and nobody else.
Encryption will only show up if supported by all recipients, and they must have sent you an e-mail before.
Toggle encryption by clicking this icon.
Messages will normally be encrypted by choice, or when replying to an encrypted message.
If both sender and recipients enable mutual mode, encryption will be enabled by default.
You can click here to learn more.
OAuth 2.0 is not supported for this email
For application maximum performance, you need to grant XryptoMail permissions to access to the following services. XryptoMail may have unexpected behavior if access to any of the services is denied!
Contacts permission is needed to update and retrieve contact status
Contents saving in external storage will fail until you grant the permission request
Control XryptoMail activities and settings will not be allowed until you grant the permission request
Grant the application to control XryptoMail activities and settings
Read mail messages will not be allowed until you grant the permission request
Grant the application to read the mail messages
Delete mail messages will not be allowed until you grant the permission request
Grant the application to delete mail messages

XryptoMail may not work properly or may have unexpected behavior as some services have been denied!\nIf you have selected \"Don\'t ask again\" option, you need to go to android Settings -> APP INFO for XryptoMail to enable the resource access permission
You are presented with each service needed by XryptoMail; please allow XryptoMail to access the services for full features support
Your device has battery usage optimization on XryptoMail; this may lead to delayed notifications or message lost.\n\nIt is recommended that you disable this optimization for XryptoMail.
XryptoMail will be put to sleep when device goes into doze-standby. Manual restart XrytoMail to receive new messages.
Your device does not support opting out of battery optimization
